1.description: The legendary witcher continues his journey, seeking contracts and dealing with the complexities of a world where humans and non-humans clash.

3.description: Reveals more of his emotional depth and capacity for love, particularly regarding children and his desire for normalcy he can never have.
The young princess of Cintra, Geralt's Child Surprise. A spirited girl with ashen hair and green eyes, showing early signs of great power.

6.description: After the fall of Cintra, she's a refugee seeking Geralt. Shows remarkable resilience and the beginning of her extraordinary abilities.

1.description: The powerful sorceress continues her tumultuous relationship with Geralt. Their bond, created by the djinn's wish, remains strong but complicated.

4.description: Shows vulnerability about her inability to have children and her complex feelings about family and belonging.

2.description: The famous bard continues to accompany Geralt, getting into romantic troubles and providing both comic relief and surprising wisdom.
A young poetess with blue eyes and a beautiful voice. Falls in love with Geralt but understands his heart belongs to Yennefer.

1.description: A mysterious knight who hires Geralt for a dragon hunt. Later revealed to be the golden dragon Villentretenmerth in human form.
Two fierce warrior women from Zerrikania who serve as bodyguards to Borch Three Jackdaws. Skilled fighters who can match any man.
A dwarven warrior and leader of a band of dwarven fighters. Practical, brave, and harbors the typical dwarven dislike of elves.
A wizard who joins the dragon hunt. Opposed to killing dragons and secretly plans to save the creature.
A pious knight errant who refuses to fight for money. Brave but rigid in his beliefs, seeing the world in black and white.

3.description: A young dryad in Brokilon Forest who helps care for Ciri. Shows the fierce protectiveness dryads have for their forest.
The silver-eyed leader of the dryads in Brokilon Forest. Ancient and wise, she protects the forest from human encroachment.
A young man transformed into a tree in Brokilon Forest as punishment for entering the dryad domain. Serves as a warning to others.

5.description: A bruxa (vampire) who preys on merchants near Oxenfurt. Beautiful and deadly, she uses her charms to lure victims.
The head of the Temple Guard in Oxenfurt and leader of the Church of the Eternal Fire. Known for his persecution of non-humans and mages.

4.description: A powerful sorceress and advisor to King Vizimir of Redania. Cunning and politically astute, she's one of the most influential mages.
A young but incredibly powerful sorcerer. Handsome and charismatic, he's rising quickly in the Brotherhood of Sorcerers.
The rectoress of Aretuza, the magical academy for young sorceresses. Stern but fair, she trained many of the current generation of sorceresses.
An elven sorceress of incredible beauty and power. One of the few elves in the Brotherhood of Sorcerers.

recaps.1: Geralt joins a dragon hunt with Yennefer, the knight Eyck, the dwarf Yarpen Zigrin, and the mysterious Borch Three Jackdaws. The hunt reveals deeper truths about the nature of good and evil.
recaps.2: In the coastal town of Bremervoord, Geralt deals with a sea monster while Dandelion falls for the poetess Little Eye. A tale of love, loss, and the price of a witcher's life.
recaps.3: Geralt enters Brokilon Forest and encounters the dryads, where he meets a young Ciri for the first time. Their destiny begins to unfold, though neither fully understands it yet.
recaps.4: At a sorcerers' gathering on Thanedd Island, Geralt navigates the complex politics of mages while dealing with his relationship with Yennefer.
recaps.5: Geralt investigates a series of murders in Oxenfurt, dealing with religious zealotry and prejudice while uncovering a vampire's hunting ground.
recaps.6: After the fall of Cintra to Nilfgaard, Geralt finally accepts his destiny and searches for Ciri, finding her at last in a merchant's wagon.
